channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024020367
item.description:
Report E-2024020367

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 8, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1268 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel deployed absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The damaged 55-gallon drum was overpacked in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020298
item.description:
Report E-2024020298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XSL contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred on the dock in St. Louis, MO. The spill consisted of approximately 2-gallons of UN1268 Rikeizai SBS-A02, which was released from a 275-gallon metal tote due to a forklift blade damaging the lid. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they were comfortable to clean the spill themselves with PPE available onsite. All impacted absorbents from cleanup were containerized into (2) 20-gallon metal drums. The shipper sent terminal personnel a replacement lid which was secured onto the tote by terminal personnel and the tote was shipped on.

item.title: Report X-2024020366
item.description:
Report X-2024020366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the 1-3-5 Unload and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: The spill was found in a trailer from another facility. The package was loaded incorrectly (on its side), and the contents had also developed loose caps which allowed for a spill to occur. Two of the four containers lost liquid and sustained denting. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Haz cage under the vent due to its strong fumes.

item.title: Report X-2024020620
item.description:
Report X-2024020620

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: STRAFFORD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package started leaking during delivery transit. Driver contained leakage until arriving at the station where QA started the clean-up procedure. DescribePack: Broken cap on 1 of the 4 gallon bottles contained in the package. Leaking was enough the soak through the outer packaging. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: After the driver arrived back at the station with the leaking package, QA contained the package in a tote and neutralizing spill powder was placed in the spill area on the truck.

Report X-2024020452

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package stated to leak in the unload, was then brought to QA in a tote. DescribePack: The plastic bottle in the box leaked from around the lid getting package wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a tote followed by a drum.

item.title: Report X-2024020527
item.description:
Report X-2024020527

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was given this package by management without very many details on where it came from or how it came to be leaking. DescribePack: Package leaked due to a loose cap on 1 of the containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: not really sure where the package was originally leaking at. It seems like most of the leakage was absorbed by the packaging.

item.title: Report E-2024020348
item.description:
Report E-2024020348

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-25
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was switching load arm from 1 compartment to the next and external valve did not close spilling 5-10 gallons of EUG in containment at the loading rack. Driver did not shut internal valve before removing the loading arm.
